activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A Anderson

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: DA Autho to Def re Electronic Evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victims G.A.C or D.K.G. (person, property, residence or family). Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

9:34 AM Defendant Mark A Anderson in court, in custody.  Attorney William A Demet in court for Mark A Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense is seeking to set a signature bond in case 19CM716. Defense has received a copy of the complaint, waives the reading and enters a ng-plea in case 22CM1071. Seeking a signature bond in case 22CM1071 and if a cash bond is to be ordered in one case that a small cash bond is ordered in both cases to allow for credit for time served. 
State does not object to a signature bond being set n case 19CM716. State provides Defense with a paper copy of the criminal complaint in case 22CM1071. Makes statements on the record. Seeking a cash bond is set in case 22CM1071 and provides arguments as to why. 
BTC: $500 cash bond set in case 22CM1071. $250 cash bond set in case 19CM716. Matter set over for status.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

2:25 PM Defendant Mark A Anderson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Mark A Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Counsel doesn't have complaint Adjourned to tomorrow to track with other misdemeanor file. Finding of probable cause for Riverside purposes
Initial appearance scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance on September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
